alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 1:35PM MST until August 14 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 134 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bagdad. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 150 and 155. State Route 96 between mile markers 0 and 6. State Route 97 between mile markers 156 and 166. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cottonwood Canyon, Big Shipp Wash, Bridle Creek, Iron Spring Wash, Conger Creek, Mineral Creek, Little Shipp Wash, Wilder Creek, Loco Creek, Boulder Creek, Pine Creek, Smith Canyon, Butte Creek, Sycamore Creek, Stinson Wash, Peoples Canyon, Salt Creek, Copper Creek, Santa Maria River, Placeritas Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Little Sycamore Wash and Contreras Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
